message:
" IBM Research undertook a challenge to build a computer system that could compete at the
human champion level in real time on the American TV quiz show, Jeopardy."

http://www.stanford.edu/class/cs124/AIMagzine-DeepQA.pdf
Debates of this manner always seem to end up in the realms of Philosophy.
John Searle today reasserted his Chinese room argument against Watson -- in the Wall Street Journal, http://ff.im/yFAd4
or better yet, discuss the algorithms in Machine Learning: https://convore.com/learn -- has any of the DeepQA code been open sourced?
@rsvp just today?  Some of the watson people spoke at my school and the head of our philosophy department said he intended to bring up the chinese room thing
The field of cognitive science ought to be redefined as "the ongoing research program of showing Searle's Chinese Room Argument to be false." --remark attributed to Patrick J. Hayes
@alex yes, in the WSJ print edition, dated 23 Feb 2011. Please tell us later what transpired at Q&A...

Somewhat relevant: 'IBM Watson - How to build your own "Watson Jr." in your basement' by Tony Pearson

https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/mydeveloperworks/blogs/InsideSystemStorage/entry/ibm_watson_how_to_build_your_own_watson_jr_in_your_basement7?lang=en
